description: A short hike by the side of a sand quarry and then onto a well worn path will bring you to a locally known fall calles Dykes Fa.. It is a "slider" type of fall and is approximately 45ft in lenght divided into two swections.  Across the stream a cave like structure has been carved by the stream in a side wall of rock.
directions: From Cambridge Narrows using highway 710 and park at quarry  45.702173°, -65.919986° and aim towards the falls at approx  45.703502°, -65.916716°
title: Dykes Fall
